condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Disaster risk management modules included in the regular national staff training package.
Number of municipalities having automated building permit system.

comment.narrative:
As of 2012, disaster risk management is not part of the regular national training programme for Government staffs.
As of 2012, the building permit process in all municipalities in Nepal is paper-based.
1. Localization of the DRRM Policy and Strategic Action Plan at the Provincial level.

- All seven provinces and 13 Municipalities/Rural Municipalities with DRR Policy and Strategic Action Plan in their final stage of development - Under leadership of the Ministry of Home Affairs, the National Disaster Response Framework (NDRF) 2013 has been revised this year - CDRMP supported for developing a Guideline for Disaster Relief Standard. The Relief Standard and Guidelines is developed in line with the new legal and administrative provisions in the Constitution, DRRM Act 2017, National DRR Policy, DRR National Strategic Action Plan and other relevant policy and legal instruments including Sphere Standard (Humanitarian Charter and Minimum Standards in Humanitarian Response - Early Recovery (ER) Cluster Flood Response Contingency Plan 2019 was developed under Humanitarian Country Team under United Nations Resident Coordinator’s leadership, in coordination with MoFAGA

2 training events on DRR Policy support 10 LGs roll out BIPAD 3 events for National ER cluster capacity strengthening Risk Sensitive Land Use Plan implemented for Karnali Province 3 eBPS launched in LGs Testing and upscaling of retrofitting technology setup
2 training events on DRR Policy support 2 events for National ER cluster capacity organized Approach paper for Risk Sensitive Land Use Plan implemented in Karnali prepared 3 eBPS launched in LGs
1. Localization of the DRRM Policy and Strategic Action Plan at the Provincial level. 2. Disaster Information Management System (DIMS) operational and disaster data updated

UNDP CDRMP has been instrumental in assisting all seven provincial governments under leadership of respective Ministry of Internal Affairs and Law (MoIAL) with participation of all Ministries at province level and stakeholders, in formulating their DRR Policy and Strategic Action Plans, in line with national level DRR Policy and Strategic Action Plans. The same has been delivered at local government levels in some 16 paalikas across the country as a pilot intervention, to be rolled out to all 753 LGs over the years. Likewise, additional five paalikas were also assisted for coming up with a total of 15 ward level local disaster and climate risk management plans. The Policy and Strategic Action Plan formulation process has been instrumental in initiating risk informed development planning in the provinces and paalikas.
